result.execSummary:
The defendant Brantly J. Trumpy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent. 
------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
------------------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brantly J. Trumpy

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brantly J. Trumpy in court with attorney Jeffrey L Hahn.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.

Defendant Brantly J. Trumpy in court with attorney Jeffrey L Hahn.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brantly J. Trumpy in court with attorney Jeffrey L Hahn.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion deadline 11-02-15. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Defendant Brantly James Trumpy in court with attorney J. Hahn.  Haley Jo Rea appeared with intern Mackenzie Fagan for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
**AMENDMENT 06-02-2015 TO INCLUDE: If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.
Signed bond filed with the court.

**AMENDMENT 06-02-2015 TO INCLUDE: If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH A.L.H. OR HER RESIDENCE.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
